caution.text: IMPORTANT! I describe here why WINVER = 0x0501 but _WIN32_WINNT = 0x0601. WINVER is set for WinXP, so size of structures will be for this system, otherwise strange things will happen. _WIN32_WINNT is set for Win7, so COM for this system will be defined and used. I do not know why WINVER is responsible for size of structures and _WIN32_WINNT for COM, but it is helpful for us. Here some info about these defines: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/oldnewthing/archive/2007/04/11/2079137.aspx it does not answer the question though. --- When drop WinXP support WINVER should be 0x0600 and will not forget to change compiler option SUBSYSTEM version to 6.00. --- Note: it is compiling under VS 2005 (without SP1) with including only header files from SDK Win 7 (this info is old, but I'll leave it for history).
